Article.ArticleTitle: Succimer Mitigates the Perioperative Risk for an Increase in Blood Lead Levels During Bulletectomy: A Case Report.

Abstract.AbstractText: A 38-year-old man with a tibial plateau fracture required treatment for elevated blood lead level (BLL) from retained bullet fragments in the same knee from a gunshot wound 21 years earlier. Oral succimer presurgery and postsurgery decreased the BLL from 58 to 15 μg/dL.

Parenteral chelation has been previously recommended to mitigate an increase in BLLs during surgical intervention to remove bullet fragments. Oral succimer was an effective and well-tolerated alternative to intravenous chelation. Further research is needed to determine the optimal route, timing, and duration of chelation in patients with elevated BLL in need of bulletectomy.
